release.action: CA UDP search improved.
Added support for -Djca.use_env=true - reads EPICS system env. variables.
If Java 6 or newer is being use, CAJ introspects network interfaces for their broadcast addresses.
Invalid UDP message caused CAJ to fall into a deadloop.
Improved connection mechanism.
In ceratin case CAJ might reconnect channel more then once.
CAJ is now distributed with CAS (Channel Access Server) implementation.
ChannelSearchManager queue synchronization fixed.
Channel connection/access rights listeners dispatching synchronization added.
Leader/follower thread pool queue fixed.
PUT_ACKT/ACKS support added.
Monitor can be created even if channel is not connected.
Channel instance reference counting. Connection event is artificially fired on listener added at channel creation of already created (cached) channel.
Behaviour of auto_addr_list fixed (now it adds auto list to addr_list and does not override it as before).
Massive connection fixed (UDP sent buffer was too big).
CAJ search algorithm reimplemented.
Channel search improved.
CAJ priority support added.

release.description: JCAS implementation, CA repeater, CAJ fixes.
release.action: CAStatus fixes (readNotify, writeNotify, eventAdd).
Added support to workaround (strip) FQDN hostname returned from getHostname(), only hostname expected.
Flow control added.
Pure Java CA Repeater implemented, com.cosylab.epics.caj.CARepeater.
Pure Java CA Server (JCAS) implemented, com.cosylab.epics.caj.cas.CAJServerContext context.

release.description: Channel.put(value) and context exception notification fixes.
release.action: Synchronous (non-callback) version of Channel.put() fixed to use CA_WRITE request instead of CA_WRITE_NOTIFY.
Added dispatching of ContextExceptionListener.contextVirtualCircuitException().
I/O event listeners (write, read, monitors) no loger get error state events (disconnect, destroyed), ContextExceptionListener.contextException() is used instead.
Timed-out pendIO() fixed.
JNIRepeater support for MacOS.

release.description: Connection lost and large arrays fix.
release.action: Minor performance/memory improvements.
On Linux (and possibly others platforms) it can happen that when connection is lost, CPU goes 100%. Fixed. Also reconnection was fixed.
Large arrays of data send/write fix/improvements.

release.description: String array and high port numbers fix.
release.action: Port numbers above 0x7000 fixed.
String array fix.

release.description: JCA 2.1.5 compatibility and access rights fix.
release.action: Added support for gov.aps.jca.Context.getVersion() method. Now users can retrieve context name and version information (at runtime).

Added global context configuration defined in JCALibrary.property. Prefix gov.aps.jca.Context can be used instead of specific prefixes to set global context configuration. Of course, specific configuration overrides default configuration(s).
Fixed access rights bug.
First release of CAJ.
